goal.en: Data analytics and adaptive learning are important in modern decision making in almost every fields today. The super computing power and big data open a variety of possibilities to shed new lights in rapid emerging fields like computer science, finance, marketing, social media, politics as well as general social and humanity sciences. This course aims to equip advanced undergraduate and graduate students with the understanding of the state-of-art modelling and algorithm knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning in the field of Finance and Economics. Given the structurally designed products, functioning mechanisms and contextual microstructure in Financial markets, we will see how these statistical learning and econometric toolboxes are infused with the financial theory to make the new paradigm shift in modern Finance in field of prediction/forecasting, investment, trading and risk management. Students are expected grasp and apply the discussed concepts and modelling techniques in a team project, turning in 2 exercises, attend the 2 exams, share reflections from the invited talk and field trip, present a team selected paper in the reading list; and present the joint team project with a paper version report in the final. These requirements are designed to help the students reconcile the background knowledge.

content.en:
The topics and the 3 Main parts reconciling concepts in Statistics/ Econometrics, AIML and Finance/Economics will cover
(A) Essential Econometric/Statistical Concepts:
‧ Trend, Stationarity and Random Walk
‧ ARIMA and GARCH
‧ Structural Breaks, Threshold, and regime Switching
‧ Extreme, Outliers, and Hyperbolic Decay
‧ Principal Component Analysis and Factor Models
‧ Cointegration and Error Correction
‧ Multivariate GARCH & Dynamic Conditional Correlation
‧ General Dependence, Copula, Tail dependence
‧ State Space Models
‧ Simulation and Sampling Recipes
o Monte Carlo simulation
o Random number generation
o Bootstrapping
(B) AIML Toolboxes
‧ Classification Methods: Logit, SVM, Clustering Analysis, KNN
‧ Boosting, Regression Tree, Random Forests
‧ Neural Network, Recurrent NN (RNN), Convolutional ＮN (CNN) , Deep NN (DNN)
‧ Sparse Regression: Shrinkage, LASSO,
‧ Sampling Techniques and (Sequential) Importance Sampling
‧ Kalman Filtering and Updating
‧ Bayesian Approach: MarKov Chain Monte Carlo & Gibbs Sampling
‧ Particle Filtering and Sequential Monte Carlo Methods
‧ Textmining, Sentiment Measurement and Analysis,
‧ Topic modelling, LDA
‧ Robustness to Nonstationarity and Parameter Uncertainty
o Bayesian learning
o Adaptive Learning
(C) Financial Applications
 Predictability
 Asset Pricing, Factor Pricing
 Sentiment Analysis
 Portfolio Allocations and Optimization
 Dynamic Trading
 Risk Management
 Corporate Governance
 Monitoring and Fraud Detection
